verses.verse: Praise <WH1984> ye the LORD.<WH3050> O give thanks<WH3034> unto the LORD;<WH3068> for<WH3588> he is good:<WH2896> for<WH3588> his mercy<WH2617> endureth forever.<WH5769>
Who <WH4310> can utter<WH4448> the mighty acts<WH1369> of the LORD?<WH3068> who can show forth<WH8085> all<WH3605> his praise?<WH8416>
Blessed <WH835> are they that keep<WH8104> judgment,<WH4941> and he that doeth<WH6213> righteousness<WH6666> at all<WH3605> times.<WH6256>
Remember <WH2142> me, O LORD,<WH3068> with the favor<WH7522> that thou bearest unto thy people:<WH5971> O visit<WH6485> me with thy salvation;<WH3444>

That I may see<WH7200> the good<WH2896> of thy chosen,<WH972> that I may rejoice<WH8055> in the gladness<WH8057> of thy nation,<WH1471> that I may glory<WH1984> with<WH5973> thine inheritance.<WH5159>
We have sinned<WH2398> with<WH5973> our fathers,<WH1> we have committed iniquity,<WH5753> we have done wickedly.<WH7561>

Our fathers<WH1> understood<WH7919> not<WH3808> thy wonders<WH6381> in Egypt;<WH4714> they remembered<WH2142> not<WH3808> <WH853> the multitude<WH7230> of thy mercies;<WH2617> but provoked<WH4784> him at<WH5921> the sea,<WH3220> even at the Red<WH5488> sea.<WH3220>
Nevertheless he saved<WH3467> them for his name's sake,<WH4616> <WH8034> that he might make<WH853> his mighty power<WH1369> to be known.<WH3045>
He rebuked<WH1605> the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220> also, and it was dried up:<WH2717> so he led<WH1980> them through the depths,<WH8415> as through the wilderness.<WH4057>
And he saved<WH3467> them from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of him that hated<WH8130> them, and redeemed<WH1350> them from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of the enemy.<WH341>
And the waters<WH4325> covered<WH3680> their enemies:<WH6862> there was not<WH3808> one<WH259> of<WH4480> them left.<WH3498>
Then believed<WH539> they his words;<WH1697> they sang<WH7891> his praise.<WH8416>
They soon<WH4116> forgot<WH7911> his works;<WH4639> they waited<WH2442> not<WH3808> for his counsel: <WH6098>
But lusted exceedingly<WH183> <WH8378> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and tempted<WH5254> God<WH410> in the desert.<WH3452>
And he gave<WH5414> them their request;<WH7596> but sent<WH7971> leanness<WH7332> into their soul.<WH5315>
They envied<WH7065> Moses<WH4872> also in the camp,<WH4264> and Aaron<WH175> the saint<WH6918> of the LORD.<WH3068>
The earth<WH776> opened<WH6605> and swallowed up<WH1104> Dathan,<WH1885> and covered<WH3680> <WH5921> the company<WH5712> of Abiram.<WH48>
And a fire<WH784> was kindled<WH1197> in their company;<WH5712> the flame<WH3852> burned up<WH3857> the wicked.<WH7563>
They made<WH6213> a calf<WH5695> in Horeb,<WH2722> and worshiped<WH7812> the molten image.<WH4541>
Thus they changed<WH4171> <WH853> their glory<WH3519> into the similitude<WH8403> of an ox<WH7794> that eateth<WH398> grass.<WH6212>
They forgot<WH7911> God<WH410> their savior,<WH3467> which had done<WH6213> great things<WH1419> in Egypt;<WH4714>
Wondrous works<WH6381> in the land<WH776> of Ham,<WH2526> and terrible things<WH3372> by<WH5921> the Red<WH5488> sea.<WH3220>

Therefore he said<WH559> that he would destroy<WH8045> them, had not<WH3884> Moses<WH4872> his chosen<WH972> stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> him in the breach,<WH6556> to turn away<WH7725> his wrath,<WH2534> lest he should destroy<WH4480> <WH7843> them.
Yea, they despised<WH3988> the pleasant<WH2532> land,<WH776> they believed<WH539> not<WH3808> his word: <WH1697>
But murmured<WH7279> in their tents,<WH168> and hearkened<WH8085> not<WH3808> unto the voice<WH6963> of the LORD.<WH3068>
Therefore he lifted up<WH5375> his hand<WH3027> against them, to overthrow<WH5307> them in the wilderness: <WH4057>
To overthrow<WH5307> their seed<WH2233> also among the nations,<WH1471> and to scatter<WH2219> them in the lands.<WH776>
They joined themselves<WH6775> also unto Baalpeor,<WH1187> and ate<WH398> the sacrifices<WH2077> of the dead.<WH4191>
Thus they provoked him to anger<WH3707> with their inventions:<WH4611> and the plague<WH4046> broke in<WH6555> upon them.
Then stood up<WH5975> Phinehas,<WH6372> and executed judgment:<WH6419> and so the plague<WH4046> was stayed.<WH6113>
And that was counted<WH2803> unto him for righteousness<WH6666> unto all generations<WH1755> <WH1755> forevermore.<WH5704> <WH5769>
They angered<WH7107> him also at<WH5921> the waters<WH4325> of strife,<WH4808> so that it went ill<WH3415> with Moses<WH4872> for their sakes: <WH5668>
Because <WH3588> they provoked<WH4784> <WH853> his spirit,<WH7307> so that he spoke unadvisedly<WH981> with his lips.<WH8193>
They did not<WH3808> destroy<WH8045> <WH853> the nations,<WH5971> concerning whom<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> commanded<WH559> them:
But were mingled<WH6148> among the heathen,<WH1471> and learned<WH3925> their works.<WH4639>
And they served<WH5647> <WH853> their idols:<WH6091> which were<WH1961> a snare<WH4170> unto them.
Yea, they sacrificed<WH2076> <WH853> their sons<WH1121> and their daughters<WH1323> unto devils,<WH7700>

And shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood,<WH1818> even the blood<WH1818> of their sons<WH1121> and of their daughters,<WH1323> whom<WH834> they sacrificed<WH2076> unto the idols<WH6091> of Canaan:<WH3667> and the land<WH776> was polluted<WH2610> with blood.<WH1818>
Thus were they defiled<WH2930> with their own works,<WH4639> and went a whoring<WH2181> with their own inventions.<WH4611>
Therefore was the wrath<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> kindled<WH2734> against his people,<WH5971> insomuch that he abhorred<WH8581> <WH853> his own inheritance.<WH5159>
And he gave<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of the heathen;<WH1471> and they that hated<WH8130> them ruled<WH4910> over them.
Their enemies<WH341> also oppressed<WH3905> them, and they were brought into subjection<WH3665> under<WH8478> their hand.<WH3027>
Many <WH7227> times<WH6471> did he deliver<WH5337> them; but they<WH1992> provoked<WH4784> him with their counsel,<WH6098> and were brought low<WH4355> for their iniquity.<WH5771>
Nevertheless he regarded<WH7200> their affliction,<WH6862> when he heard<WH8085> <WH853> their cry: <WH7440>
And he remembered<WH2142> for them his covenant,<WH1285> and repented<WH5162> according to the multitude<WH7230> of his mercies.<WH2617>
He made<WH5414> them also to be pitied<WH7356> of<WH6440> all<WH3605> those that carried them captives.<WH7617>

Save <WH3467> us, O LORD<WH3068> our God,<WH430> and gather<WH6908> us from among<WH4480> the heathen,<WH1471> to give thanks<WH3034> unto thy holy<WH6944> name,<WH8034> and to triumph<WH7623> in thy praise.<WH8416>

Blessed <WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> from<WH4480> everlasting<WH5769> to<WH5704> everlasting:<WH5769> and let all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> say,<WH559> Amen.<WH543> Praise<WH1984> ye the LORD.<WH3050>
